result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael Dimas was found guilty of OWI (9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to any other sentence the defendant is currently serving.  Defendant is to receive 149 days of sentence credit.  On July 13, 2015 - Court ordered the sentence credit be amended to 252 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
1.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
2.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that serves alcohol by-the-drink
3.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent
Restitution hearing to be set within 60 days. On June 8, 2015 the Court orders restitution in the amount of $7,143.08 and is to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision.

2:15 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin. Court has received an amended summary of restitutionin the amount of $7,143.08.

Timothy D. Jones sworn, direct by DA Christenson, is employed as Sargent of Investigation for Berlin Police Department for approximately 25 years.  Was employed on the date in question. Cross exam by Atty Selsing.  Re-direct by DA Christenson.  Re-Cross by Atty Selsing.  

Jill Hill (via telphone) sworn, direct by DA Christenson, is employed at EMC Insurance Company.  Exhibit # 1 - Print out of dollar values.  Cross exam by Atty Selsing.  

DA admits Exhibit #1 into evidence.  NO objection by Atty Selsing.  Court receives Exhibit #1.

Michael Dimas sworn, direct by Atty Selsing - is the defendant in this case.  Cross exam by DA Christenson.  Re-drect by Atty Selsing.

Argument by DA Christitution - requests restitution in full.  Argument by Atty Selsing.

Court finds the State has met the burden of proof and orders restitution in the amount of $7,143.08 to be paid during the time of extended supervision.  Statement by Atty Selsing regarding civil judgment.  Court denies the request.

Court adjourned at 3:18 p.m.
Summary of Restitution w/attachments - $7,143.08

Per Victim Witness Coordinator - No Victims in this case
of hearing held on April 6, 2015, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Brenda L. Sosinsky - Court Reporter
from Green Lake County Department of Health & Human Services
Miscellaneous Papers (CONFIDENTIAL DOCUMENT)

10:06 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Christenson recites plea agreement - upon plea to OWI 9th offense, with no repeater, count 2 will be dismissed and read-in and count 3 will be dismissed.  Atty Selsing concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court will recess for plea questionnaire to be done.

Court adjourned at 10:09 a.m.

Court reconvenes at 10:26 a.m.  Same appearances.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to OWI-9th offense.    Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in and orders count 3 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing argument by DA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Selsing.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

4 years of Initial Confinement and 4 years of Extended Supervision, concurrent to any other sentence the defendant is currently serving

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

court costs
D.L. revocation for 2 years
IID for 2 years
AODA
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is not to be on any premises that serves alcohol by-the-drink
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent

Restitution - to be set for restitution hearing within 60 days

Defendant is not eligible for CIP, but eligible for the SAR program.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit from 07/27/2014 to when he was sentenced or started serving the sentence. (DeAnna will confirm)

Court adjourned at 10:54 a.m.
Fox Lake Correctional Institution - 04/06/2015 at 9:30 a.m. (Plea & Sentencing)

Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the complaint - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties and as a repeater.  Court finds probable cause.

Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.
